intro: Pedicularis albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or white with a distinctive white margin. It grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is often found in open, sunny environments. The species is notable for its unique floral structure and its role in local ecosystems.
